intro: Liliacum persicum, commonly known as the Persian lily, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to deep pink. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with narrow, grass-like leaves and a single stem that bears a cluster of blooms. Its flowers are often used in traditional medicine and as ornamental plants due to their beauty and fragrance. Liliacum persicum thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
